title: Free-body diagrams-platform supported by two ropes

content.question: A platform of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is held at rest by two ropes connected to its ends, as shown in the diagram on the left. A block, also of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>, is placed on the center of the platform. A student draws a free-body diagram representing the forces exerted on the platform while it is at rest, as shown in the diagram on the right. Which of the following claims best explains why the diagram is incorrect?

choices.label: The tension forces from the ropes do not point in the correct directions.
The diagram does not include components of the tension forces in the ropes.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
